Even though China will certainly create its own cryptocurrency, I wonder if bitcoin maximalists will be kind enough to thank President Xi today.

In Jan 2016, Chairman of Central Bank of China says Blockchain is important. Bitcoin companies in China suddenly all became blockchain companies. And thankfully (for me), price started to recover, and lead into the #altszn in 2017, as well as $BTC ATH again at $20,000 in Dec.

In Oct 2013, China CCTV first featured bitcoin, $BTC hit its ATH 2 months later in Dec at $1000. (A few months after this, I sold my house and went all-in on $BTC at $600. And 2 months after that, $BTC price hit $200, and stayed there for about 2 years.)
Can anyone tell me the last time Bitcoin moved up >30% in one day? This is unreal.

This week in crypto: 1. China going all in on blockchain 2. Bitcoin up 30%+ in one day 3. Bakkt hits volume all-time highs 4. Zuckerberg testifies in Congress 5. Morgan Creek raises $60M 6. Circle spins out Poloniex 7. Bitcoin is still not dead :) Another week of progress!

Important message as we enter the next Bitcoin bull market: - BTC is very volatile - You can lose all of your money - Only invest what is ok to lose - Twitter is not investment advice - Don't buy BTC with credit cards - Keep low time preference - Do your own research

Too volatile to be priced in. Bitcoin denominated investor/hodlers money is already in. For Fiat investors to price in the halvening needs to be short enough time-frames that the upside offsets the Fiat volatility exposure. Higher volatility, like last 24hrs just delays price-in.

My personal view of Bitcoin bull markets is in 3 phases. A pop out of accumulation. We are still playing this out. The second phase is a nice long, steady climb with lowish volatility. (The 3rd stage is mania when volatility goes out of control).
